main event: An object emitting a smoke trail was observed over Columbus, Ohio on 1 August 1949.
interesting points: The smoke trail was visible for about 15 seconds., The object was estimated to be flying at an altitude of 30,000-40,000 feet., Witnesses described the object's trajectory as westerly with a smokey appearance resembling a JATO takeoff., The phenomenon was observed from the Control Tower at Port Columbus Airport., There were various reports on the sighting, indicating potential curiosity and investigation from local authorities.
witness description: CAA Controllers and Airport Traffic Control employees in Columbus, Ohio
